doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 184[Air Date: 2/19/1986]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 184[Air Date: 2/19/1986]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. Georgetown University The Human Rights Commission2. New San Francisco "poppers" legislation3. Gay man wins case, kills man in self defense after a year of harassment and physical abuse4. Gay and lesbian counseling service and United Liquors seventeen thousand dollar grant5. Jim Flint, President of Prairie State Democratic Club, announces entrance into Democratic Primary as Cook County Commissioner6. "How to Lobby your Legislature" part two with Jim Levin, New York City Human Rights CommissionerCOMMERCIAL: CASIO Pocket TV7. San Francisco Health Department Task Force recommends abortions for pregnant women with AIDS8. Seramin does not treat AIDS9. New York hospital faces heavy penalties for mistreating persons with AIDS10. Job discrimination and AIDS11. Atlanta Man sets computer to call right winged conservative Jerry Falwell's toll free number every thirty seconds for eight months after anti-gay remarks, each call cost two dollarsCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp12. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Robert Bolton, volunteer on GMHC hotline, discusses involvement in program13. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. This Week in Gay History with Jeff Bixby, includes clip2. Sybil Bruncheon opens presentCOMMERCIAL: The Monster3. Sybil and hatsCOMMERCIAL: Sybil Bruncheon T-Shirts4. Books Reviews: Malcolm Boyd's "Half Laughing, Half Crying" and Howard Cruse's "Wendel"COMMERCIAL: Commodore Plus 45. Current events/media/culture, includes sitcom clip and news coverage
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 8 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 184[Air Date: 2/19/1986]: February 1986
